sub_title: Equity Derivatives Trader at All Options
summary:
I would consider myself as a curious and creative guy, passionate about mathematics, thirst for knowledge and always thrilled to tackle new challenges. I like to be always mentally stimulated. At a personal level, I am huge people-person used to multi-cultural environments and a natural team-player who enjoys discussing ideas and ways to solve problems.

Along my academic career, I have proven talent and excellent skills for mathematics and logic: 
-	Awarded in National Mathematical Olympiads
-	Earned a BSc. and MSc. in Electrical Engineering ranking top 1-2%. Final project awarded by the National College of Telecommunication Engineering for its contribution to Security and Defense. 
-	BSc. in Mathematics (first class honors provisionally) 
-	PhD in Computational Electromagnetics with calification Summa Cum Laude and more than 40 papers published in international conferences and journals. Awarded by international organisms.

Passionate about financial markets themselves and how mathematics can be applied to them, being my dream career. I joined a MSc. in Quantitative Finance and realized a 1-year internship that included projects in:
- Automatized portfolio management (roboadvisors) using modified Black-Litterman models.
- Quantitative strategies for trading/investing index equity options.

Currently working for a start-up which applies Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques to generate trading strategies. My role there as quantitative researcher is to integrate such strategies in order to satisfy the risk-return metrics specified by the clients.

In my personal life I enjoy sports, nutrition, travelling and films. I have worked 2 months as personal trainer in Kuwait and as international model for world-class brands (Hugo Boss, New Balance, Coca-Cola, Turkish Airlines, …) in several countries (Spain, France, Germany, Ireland, UK, USA, Turkey, Kuwait, China, Brazil, India) for more than 7 years. Spanish Men’s Health Cover February 2014.

profile_positions.description:
Integration of artificial intelligence (AI) trading strategies with quantitative portfolio management techniques. 

Achievements:
- Developed low-risk portfolio satisfying classical and advanced risk metrics under the client requirements, obtaining a high α respect to the traded instruments/markets
profile_positions.title: Quantitative Portfolio Manager

profile_positions.description:
Development of quantitative portfolio management strategies (roboadvisors). Pricing financial derivatives and developing strategies to generate capital investing/trading them.

Ahievements:
-	Implemented an automatized portfolio management system with proprietary algorithms based on Black-Litterman models.
-	Created successful models and trading strategies for financial derivatives overcoming market benchmark metrics.
profile_positions.title: Quantitative Analyst, Portfolio Strategy Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Filter modelling and development of synthesis algorithms to develope Q/V/W bands filters robust front manufacturing tolerances. Partnership with Thales Alenia Space and  the European Space Agency (ESA).

Achievements:

- Design of a set of 4 inductively coupled rectangular filters based in Groove Gap Technology (using TE101 and TE103 modes, symmetrical and asymmetrical iris). Filters responses overcome actual rectangular waveguide technology, avoiding important problems as spurious bands.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Filter modelling and development of synthesis algorithms to develope Q/V/W bands filters robust front manufacturing tolerances. Partnership with Thales Alenia Space and  the European Space Agency (ESA).

Achievements:

- Design of a set of 4 inductively coupled rectangular filters based in Groove Gap Technology (using TE101 and TE103 modes, symmetrical and asymmetrical iris). Filters responses overcome actual rectangular waveguide technology, avoiding important problems as spurious bands.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Analysis and design of mm-wave passive structures. Development of optimization strategies. Post-manufacture yield analysis and correction algorithms. BSc/MSc teaching assistant.

Achievements:
- Developed an algorithm with quantified introduced error to obtain straightforwardly the impedance of complex periodic structures such as Gap Waveguide transmission lines.
- Designed a microwave filter (V-band) with outstanding performance. The design was finalist at the Young Engineer Prize of the 44th European Microwave Conference in Rome (Italy).
-Implemented a post-manufacturing correction algorithm based on functional analysis and optimization. Sucessfully recovered the response of a very error-sensitive device.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-Implemented self-developed teaching schemes in the subjects of Differential Equations and Circuit Theory. Researched in innovative learning techniques with succesfull practical results.
-Obtained high qualifications in the professor performance evaluation.
profile_positions.title: Phd Student Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Development of specific analysis algorithms for Gap Waveguide topologies.

Achievements:
- Developed a new hybrid numerical-analytical tool for the analysis of Gap Waveguides (periodic structures) two orders of magnitude faster than general purpose software
profile_positions.title: Visiting PhD Student

profile_positions.description:
Analysis and design of THz passive structures. Implementation of algorithms to solve computationally complex electromagnetic problems. BSc/MSc teaching assistant.

Achievemetns:
- Reported the first complete solution of wire-type waveguides for arbitrary parameters. Developed efficient and robust MATLAB codes which overcome general purpose software problems.
- Recovered very noisy measured data in THz setups. Generated coherent plots and identified false errors and true patterns using correlation with numerical simulations and acquired knowledge.
profile_positions.title: PhD Student

company.name: Institute for Telecommunication and Multimedia Applications (iTEAM)

profile_positions.company: Institute of Telecommunications and Multimedia Applications (iTEAM)
profile_positions.description:
Complete theoretical analysis and numerical characterization of THz surface waveguides.

Achievements:

- Developed models and design algorithms for THz wire waveguides.
- Diffused innovative results and conclusions through a detailed technical report. Work published in the IRMWW-THz 2011, Houston (USA).
profile_positions.title: Advanced Technician Assistant PROMETEUS project

profile_positions.description:
Theoretical and numerical analysis (MATLAB) of conventional and new waveguiding structures operating in a new environment (THz frequencies). Parametrization and optimization.

Achievements:
-Obtained innovative results regarding to the behavior of waveguides at THz. Work awarded by the National College of Telecommunication Engineers due to the contribution to the area of Security & Defense.
profile_positions.title: Pre-graduate Research Assistant
